sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Nuburu Secures $25 Million Financing to Bolster Liquidity
feed.summary: Nuburu has secured $25 million in financing from YA II PN, Ltd., receiving approximately $23.25 million in capital for a debenture and warrants. This financing is intended to bolster liquidity, support existing business plans, and cover general working capital, despite potential dilution for existing shareholders. TipRanks' AI Analyst rated BURU as Underperform due to financial instability, though a strategic partnership with HUMBL offers a potential growth avenue.

feed.title: Nuburu Secures $25 Million Financing to Bolster Liquidity
feed.summary: Nuburu, Inc. completed a $25 million financing transaction with YA II PN, Ltd. on December 17, 2025, receiving approximately $23.25 million in exchange for a debenture and warrants. The net proceeds of about $21.85 million are intended for existing business plans, general working capital, and corporate purposes, which will bolster the company's liquidity position despite potential future dilution for existing shareholders. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates BURU as "Underperform" due to financial instability but notes a recent strategic partnership as a potential growth avenue.

feed.title: Nuburu Signs Multiple Financing Agreements
feed.summary: Nuburu has finalized a $25 million financing package through several agreements, primarily with YA II PN. These include a Securities Purchase Agreement, a $25 million debenture, and a Registration Rights Agreement for warrant share resale. Joseph Gunnar & Co. acted as the placement agent, with net proceeds of approximately $21.85 million allocated for working capital and general corporate purposes.

feed.title: Nuburu (NYSEAMERICAN:BURU) Shares Down 0.9% - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Nuburu (NYSEAMERICAN:BURU) shares fell 0.9% during mid-day trading to $0.2020, with trading volume significantly below its daily average. The company, which specializes in high-power blue laser technology, reported a quarterly loss and currently trades below its 50-day and 200-day moving averages. Institutional ownership stands at 41.61%, with Geode Capital Management recently increasing its stake.

feed.title: NUBURU Secures $25 Million Financing
feed.summary: NUBURU has secured a $25 million financing deal with YA II PN, Ltd., involving an unsecured debenture and warrant packages. This capital infusion will strengthen NUBURU's financial position, accelerating its strategy to become a vertically integrated defense and security platform. The company plans to acquire Orbit Srl for mission-critical software and Lyocon Srl for photonics expansion, and has executed the first tranche of a strategic support program for Tekne SpA focusing on defense mobility.

feed.title: NUBURU secures $23.25 million financing to accelerate defense strategy By Investing.com
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American:BURU) has secured $23.25 million in financing from YA II PN, Ltd., aimed at accelerating its transformation into a vertically integrated defense and security platform despite significant financial challenges. The funding, provided through an unsecured debenture and warrant packages, will support acquisitions of Italian firms Orbit Srl and Lyocon Srl, and strategic support for Tekne SpA. This move positions NUBURU to expand its defense technology capabilities and pursue advanced UAV solutions.

feed.title: NUBURU (NYSE American: BURU) lines up $23.25M plus $46.9M warrant upside
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU) has secured a $23.25 million gross cash infusion through a Securities Purchase Agreement with YA II PN, Ltd. This financing involves issuing a $25.0 million unsecured debenture and warrant packages, designed to accelerate NUBURU's transformation into a vertically integrated, multi-domain Defense & Security platform. The company is actively pursuing acquisitions and strategic investments in mission-critical software, photonics, defense mobility, and advanced UAV platforms, with potential for an additional $46.9 million from warrant exercises.

feed.title: Nuburu Announces Acquisition of Lyocon S.r.l.
feed.summary: Nuburu (BURU) has announced its intention to acquire Lyocon S.r.l., an Italian company specializing in laser-engineering and photonics. The acquisition involves an upfront payment of $500,000 and a deferred payment of $1,500,000, with potential earnout payments based on performance. The transaction is expected to close by December 31, 2025, and Lyocon will operate as a subsidiary with a planned investment of $1,000,000 for its operations over the next two years.

feed.title: Nuburu (NYSE American: BURU) signs term sheet to buy Lyocon with cash, convertible note and earnout
feed.summary: Nuburu, Inc. has signed a binding term sheet to acquire Lyocon S.r.l., an Italian laser-engineering and photonics company, for a total consideration ranging from $1.5 million to $3 million. The payment will include cash, a six-month convertible promissory note, and a potential earnout based on future milestones. The deal is expected to close by December 31, 2025, and Lyocon will operate as a Nuburu subsidiary, with its current owners remaining in management and technical advisory roles.

feed.title: NUBURU (NYSE American: BURU) inks $2M Lyocon buy to grow EU laser and defense platform
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU) has signed a binding agreement to acquire Lyocon S.r.l., an Italian laser-engineering and photonics company, for $2 million. This acquisition aims to expand NUBURU's European engineering footprint and advance its transformation into a vertically integrated Defense & Security Technology Hub. The deal supports NUBURU's strategic partnership with Tekne S.p.A. and is expected to close by December 31, 2025.

feed.title: Nuburu signs JV framework to develop NATO-compliant drones using AM
feed.summary: Nuburu has announced a joint-venture company with Nuburu Defense LLC and Maddox Defense Inc. to design, manufacture, and deploy adaptable military drones for NATO and allied customers, using blue-laser Additive Manufacturing. The JV expects to achieve approximately $100 million in annual revenue by the end of 2028 and will establish a European-based manufacturing and research hub under Italian law. This collaboration aims to leverage combined technical expertise for compliant, next-generation drone solutions, anticipating strong synergies with Tekne’s mobility technologies.

feed.title: NUBURU and Maddox enter JV to advance drone technology
feed.summary: NUBURU, a blue-laser technology pioneer, has formed a joint venture with Nuburu Defense LLC and Maddox Defense Incorporated to develop, manufacture, and deploy advanced drone systems for military and commercial use. The JV aims to leverage rapid-manufacturing pods with 3D printing and modular avionics, targeting NATO and allied markets with an estimated $7-10.3 billion annual opportunity and projecting $100 million in annual revenue by 2028. The partnership will establish a European-based manufacturing and research hub under Italian law, ensuring compliance with export-control regulations.

feed.title: Nuburu, Inc.(BURU) Stock: Surges with €2 Million Commitment to Tekne
feed.summary: Nuburu, Inc. (BURU) saw a stock price increase after executing the first €2 million of a larger €15 million commitment to Tekne S.p.A., bolstering their strategic partnership in defense technology and industrial capabilities. This investment aims to enhance Tekne’s working capital and industrial reach, facilitate joint development in laser-based systems and security solutions, and expand their presence in global defense and security markets. Future plans include a €13 million convertible shareholder loan, a 2.9% equity stake acquisition, and a joint venture with Maddox Defense Incorporated for unmanned aerial systems development.

feed.title: NUBURU (NYSE: BURU) completes first €2M tranche in €15M Tekne partnership funding
feed.summary: NUBURU, a pioneer in blue laser technology, has successfully executed the first €2 million of a €15 million financial support package to Tekne S.p.A., bolstering a strategic partnership. This funding is part of a broader commitment to strengthen Tekne's working capital and industrial capabilities, with both companies confirming progress on industrial cooperation, financial support, and joint go-to-market initiatives. The partnership aims to build a unified defense and security platform across Italy, Europe, and the Americas, involving joint innovation, market expansion, and defense-sector initiatives.

feed.title: Nuburu, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Nuburu, Inc. has released its Q3 2025 Form 10-Q report, detailing significant financial and operational challenges, including zero revenue and a substantial net loss. The company is actively pursuing a growth and diversification strategy, expanding into defense-tech and forming a new subsidiary, NUBURU Defense, LLC, despite concerns about its ability to continue as a going concern. Operational restructuring and new strategic partnerships are underway to adapt to these challenges.

feed.title: 99,829,613 Common Stock of Nuburu, Inc. are subject to a Lock-Up Agreement Ending on 16-NOV-2025.
feed.summary: 99,829,613 Common Stock of Nuburu, Inc. (BURU) are under a lock-up agreement from September 16, 2025, to November 16, 2025. This 60-day lock-up period restricts the company, its officers, directors, and significant stockholders from selling or offering common stock and convertible securities. The agreement aims to stabilize the stock price post-offering.

feed.title: NUBURU, Tekne to establish Network Contract by Nov 30, 2025
feed.summary: NUBURU (NYSE American: BURU) and Tekne have renewed their strategic alliance, formalized by an Updated Tekne Agreement dated November 10, 2025. This partnership, which includes a €15 million financial commitment from NUBURU to Tekne, aims to accelerate defense innovation and next-generation military drone development, particularly through the establishment of a "Network Contract" under Italian law by November 30, 2025. The collaboration focuses on strategic cooperation, joint go-to-market strategies across various regions, sharing assets, and co-investing in innovation projects within the defense and security sectors.

feed.title: NUBURU: Defense Transformation Advanced With Completion Of First Phase In Orbit Acquisition
feed.summary: NUBURU has completed the first phase of its acquisition of Orbit S.r.l., investing $1.5 million for a 10.7% equity stake and establishing a presence in the software-driven defense and security market. This move expands NUBURU beyond hardware into high-value software solutions for operational resilience and crisis management, with plans for full ownership of Orbit and significant revenue targets for their joint venture with Maddox Defense Incorporated by 2028. The acquisition positions NUBURU as a diversified defense-resilience technology company, focusing on mission readiness and continuous operational capabilities.

feed.title: NUBURU to Acquire Orbit, Expanding Defense & Security Hub with Cutting-Edge Operational Resilience Solutions
feed.summary: NUBURU announced its subsidiary, Nuburu Defense LLC, will acquire Orbit S.r.l., an Italian software company specializing in operational resilience, for $12.5 million. This acquisition aims to expand NUBURU’s Defense & Security Hub and integrate Orbit's SaaS technology with existing systems, targeting a $3.6 billion defense market. The transaction will occur in two phases, with NUBURU's Executive Chairman Alessandro Zamboni owning Orbit, and the deal being reviewed by an independent financial advisor.

feed.title: Nuburu forms alliance with Maddox Defense
feed.summary: Nuburu, a blue-laser technology developer, has partnered with Maddox Defense to form a joint-venture company, controlled by Nuburu Defense, focused on developing and deploying advanced drone systems for military and commercial applications. The JV expects to achieve approximately $100 million in annual revenue by the end of 2028, targeting the NATO UAV defense market and commercial sectors. This alliance leverages combined expertise and aims to provide compliant drone solutions, with Nuburu Defense contributing up to $10 million in capital funding.

feed.title: NUBURU, Inc. (BURU) Stock: Rebounds Amid Compliance Clarification and Defense Expansion Drive - parameter.io
feed.summary: NUBURU (BURU) stock rebounded strongly in pre-market trading after the company clarified its full compliance with NYSE American regulations, addressing a previous administrative non-compliance notice. This resolution, coupled with NUBURU's ongoing strategic transformation led by Alessandro Zamboni and Dario Barisoni, including acquisitions like Orbit specializing in defense resilience solutions, has instilled renewed confidence in its advanced manufacturing and defense technology initiatives. The company is actively expanding its defense and manufacturing footprint, emphasizing cost optimization and global defense integration to achieve sustainable growth and profitability.

feed.title: NUBURU Restores NYSE Compliance and Strengthens Defense Transformation With Its Acquisition Plan Underway - The Joplin Globe
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU) has confirmed its full compliance with NYSE American regulatory disclosure requirements after resolving a technical communication timing issue. The company is actively pursuing an acquisition strategy to accelerate its defense applications and recently announced the acquisition of Orbit, a software-as-a-service company specializing in defense and security operational resilience solutions. These actions are part of NUBURU's ongoing transformation, led by co-CEOs Alessandro Zamboni and Dario Barisoni, to expand its presence in defense and advanced manufacturing sectors.

feed.title: NUBURU Restores NYSE Compliance and Strengthens Defense Transformation With Its Acquisition Plan Underway - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: NUBURU announced its full compliance with NYSE American regulatory disclosures after resolving an administrative issue, emphasizing that there were no financial or operational deficiencies. The company, under its dual-CEO leadership, is actively pursuing strategic acquisitions to expand its defense applications of blue-laser technology and strengthen its market footprint in key allied defense sectors. These developments highlight NUBURU's ongoing transformation, cost optimization, and focus on long-term profitability and global visibility within the defense and advanced manufacturing sectors.

feed.title: NUBURU Restores NYSE Compliance and Strengthens Defense Transformation With Its Acquisition Plan Underway
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU) has announced that it is back in full compliance with NYSE American regulatory disclosure requirements. A previous non-compliance warning was due to an administrative delay in disclosure timing, not financial or operational issues. The company is actively pursuing acquisitions to accelerate its defense transformation, exemplified by an agreement to evaluate a potential acquisition for its blue-laser technology and the acquisition of Orbit, a software-as-a-service company.

feed.title: NUBURU, Inc. (BURU) Stock: Rises 7.7% but Faces Pre-Market Dip After Compliance Warning - parameter.io
feed.summary: NUBURU (BURU) stock rose 7.74% in regular trading but dipped in pre-market after NYSE American LLC issued a compliance warning. The warning concerned a procedural lapse related to the company's October 1, 2025 press release announcing a dual-CEO structure, which was not disclosed in advance of trading hours. NUBURU is now strengthening its internal reporting processes to address the compliance issue.

feed.title: Nuburu receives NYSE American warning over disclosure compliance By Investing.com - Investing.com Nigeria
feed.summary: The article reports that Nuburu received a warning from NYSE American regarding disclosure compliance. The notice indicates a client-side exception occurred while loading content for the investing.com Nigeria site.

feed.title: Orion, Nuburu, And BioCryst Shares All Tumble On Bad News
feed.summary: Shares of Orion, Nuburu, and BioCryst all tumbled recently due to disappointing news from each company. Orion revised its 2025 adjusted EBITDA outlook downward, Nuburu received a NYSE American warning regarding a CEO change, and BioCryst's $700 million acquisition bid for Astria Therapeutics raised investor concerns. These events highlight how quickly negative updates, regulatory issues, and acquisition news can impact investor confidence and stock prices across the market.

feed.title: Nuburu receives NYSE American warning over disclosure compliance By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: The article reports that Nuburu, a laser technology company, has received a warning from NYSE American regarding non-compliance with disclosure requirements. This development could impact the company's stock listing and investor confidence.

feed.title: Nuburu receives NYSE American warning over disclosure compliance By Investing.com - Investing.com South Africa
feed.summary: This article from Investing.com South Africa reports that Nuburu has received a warning from NYSE American regarding disclosure compliance. The content provided is minimal due to an application error, indicating that the full article text was not loaded.

feed.title: Nuburu Inc. announces receipt of warning letter from NYSE American - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Nuburu Inc. announced on October 13, 2025, that it has received a warning letter from NYSE American. The article highlights recent activities of Nuburu, including new appointments and funding events, suggesting an active period for the company despite the warning.

feed.title: NUBURU stock falls after receiving NYSE American warning letter - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article appears to be broken or corrupted, displaying an application error instead of the intended content. It states "Application error: a client-side exception has occurred while loading www.investing.com". Therefore, no information about NUBURU stock or a NYSE American warning letter can be extracted.

feed.title: NYSE Warning Letter: NUBURU Discloses Failure to Provide Required Advance Notice for Oct 1 Dual‑CEO Release - Stock Titan
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. announced receipt of a warning letter from NYSE American for failing to provide advance notice regarding its October 1, 2025, press release about implementing a dual-CEO structure. The company acknowledged the oversight and is enhancing its procedures to ensure future compliance with NYSE American Company Guide rules for material news announcements.

feed.title: Nuburu Inc. Announces Receipt of Warning Letter from NYSE American - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: NUBURU Inc. received a warning letter from NYSE American for failing to provide advance notification about a material news announcement regarding its dual-CEO structure. The company acknowledged the oversight and is taking steps to improve its compliance with material information dissemination procedures. NUBURU has publicly disclosed the warning letter as required by the Exchange.

feed.title: Nuburu Inc. Announces Receipt of Warning Letter from NYSE American - The Joplin Globe
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. announced it received a warning letter from NYSE American LLC for non-compliance with Section 401(a) of the Company Guide. The warning relates to the company's failure to provide advance notification to the Exchange regarding a press release issued on October 1, 2025, concerning a dual-CEO structure. NUBURU has acknowledged the concerns and is implementing enhanced procedures to ensure future compliance.

feed.title: Is Nuburu Inc. forming a bottoming base - Quarterly Market Review & AI Enhanced Execution Alerts - newser.com
feed.summary: This article indicates that the requested page does not exist on the Newser website. It provides a message stating, "We're sorry, but the page you have requested does not exist," and directs users to the Newser home page or various other sections of the news site.

feed.title: Nuburu Signs Agreement to Evaluate Potential Acquisition for Accelerated Growth in Defense Applications of Blue Laser Technology
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. announced an agreement to evaluate a controlling interest acquisition aimed at accelerating its expansion into defense applications of blue laser technology. This potential acquisition would integrate advanced R&D, ISO-certified production, and an established client base to develop and commercialize cutting-edge defense solutions through a new subsidiary, Nuburu Defense LLC. The move is expected to leverage the Partner's expertise and provide significant advantages in defense applications over traditional infrared laser systems.

feed.title: NUBURU Explores Acquisition To Boost Defense Applications Of Blue Laser Technology
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (BURU) has signed an agreement with a strategic partner to explore acquiring a controlling stake, aiming to integrate its blue laser technology into advanced defense applications. This move seeks to leverage the partner's expertise and an established client base to accelerate NUBURU's expansion into the defense sector and develop new defense technology products through NUBURU Defense LLC. The strategy also includes synergies with a recent agreement with Tekne S.p.A.

feed.title: NUBURU Secures Strategic $65 Million Funding Program to Accelerate Commercialization, Including $15 Million PIPE Investment & $50M Equity Line of Credit
feed.summary: NUBURU, a leader in industrial blue laser technology, announced a $65 million funding program to accelerate commercialization. This includes a $15 million direct investment and a $50 million equity line of credit (ELOC) with Liqueous LP. The funding provides immediate capital and long-term support for NUBURU's strategic growth, intellectual property expansion, and technology advancement.

feed.title: NUBURU Announces a $3 Million Dollar Capital Infusion by Strategic Investors and New Customer Orders
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. announced a $3 million capital infusion from strategic investors and new customer orders, marking a significant step towards growth and diversification. This investment, led by fintech industry leader Alessandro Zamboni, is expected to accelerate product fulfillment and revenue generation. The company also secured initial purchase orders for its BL-300s to a leading battery systems manufacturer in the sustainable energy market, with the blue laser technology to be used in EV battery module production.

feed.title: NUBURU, Inc. Receives Notice of Non-Compliance with the NYSE
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. announced it received a notice of non-compliance from the NYSE American Market due to its Audit Committee no longer having at least two independent directors. The company has until January 4, 2025, to regain compliance and is actively seeking to appoint two independent directors to its Board. This notice does not immediately affect the trading of NUBURU's stock.

feed.title: Nuburu cancels special meeting due to lack of quorum
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU) canceled its Special Proxy Statement meeting due to a lack of a quorum, with the proposals now deferred to the annual meeting expected by October 31, 2024. The company emphasized the crucial need for these proposals to secure working capital and support its business plans and commercialization efforts. NUBURU faces financial challenges, including a significant debt burden and rapid cash burn, as highlighted by InvestingPro insights, making stockholder approval for financing strategies critical.

feed.title: Nuburu Inc.’s Stock Volatility: Opportunity or Risk?
feed.summary: Nuburu Inc.'s stock experienced significant volatility, with its share price trading down by -11.86% on Thursday, October 10, 2024, influenced by disappointing sales figures and slowing market growth expectations in the laser technology sector. The company's financial health shows substantial revenue but deep losses and high leverage, alongside a strategic focus on LED technology that presents both opportunities and risks for investors. Analysts and investors are observing the tension between speculative trading, technological advancements, and financial precarity, making its future trajectory uncertain but potentially impactful.

feed.title: Nuburu agrees $65M equity-plus-credit deal
feed.summary: Nuburu, a Colorado-based company specializing in blue industrial lasers, has secured a new funding arrangement worth up to $65 million with Delaware hedge fund Liqueous LP. The deal includes an immediate $3 million, weekly instalments totaling another $10 million, and access to a $50 million "equity line of credit." This funding is crucial for Nuburu, which has faced significant operating losses and low cash reserves, enabling it to accelerate commercialization and strengthen its balance sheet.

feed.title: CORRECTION – Liqueous LP Announces $65 Million Financing Program in Nuburu Inc. (BURU), Highlighting Comprehensive Financing with Limited Dilution
feed.summary: Liqueous LP has announced a comprehensive $65 million financing program for Nuburu Inc. (BURU), a high-power industrial blue laser technology company. This program includes a $15 million direct capital injection and a $50 million equity line of credit, structured to provide predictable, low-cost capital with limited dilution. The financing corrects a previous release, notably updating a client mention from U.S. Navy and GE Additive to the U.S. Air Force, highlighting Nuburu's growing market presence.

feed.title: Why Is Nuburu (BURU) Stock Up 47% Today?
feed.summary: Nuburu (BURU) stock is experiencing a 47% surge in value today, accompanied by heavy trading volume. This significant movement follows the company's recent securing of $500,000 in funding through an unsecured, subordinated convertible note with a major investor, Esousa, which is also a 9.9% shareholder. The terms of the convertible note include a 5% OID, 15% interest, and a six-month maturity date.

feed.title: Blue Laser Firm NUBURU Explores Strategic Alternatives Amid NYSE Compliance Challenges
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU), a blue laser technology firm, is exploring strategic alternatives including mergers and sales due to NYSE American listing compliance issues stemming from low stock prices. The company has appointed Northland Capital Markets as its financial advisor to navigate this period of financial turbulence. NUBURU's blue laser technology holds potential in additive manufacturing for challenging metals like copper and aluminum, despite its current financial precariousness.

feed.title: Nuburu hopes for rebound; secures bridge finance
feed.summary: Nuburu, a developer of blue industrial lasers, has secured $5.5 million in interest-free bridge loans from investors to stabilize its cash flow following a challenging third quarter with sales under $0.2 million. The company, which experienced a significant drop from its initial SPAC fundraising expectations, is looking to a rebound in laser system sales and focusing on strengthening commercial activity and scaling manufacturing. Despite recent struggles, Nuburu is optimistic about its blue laser technology for industrial applications and has secured a purchase order from a major electronics manufacturer.

feed.title: NUBURU, Inc. Announces Date for Third Quarter 2023 Earnings Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: NUBURU, Inc. (NYSE American: BURU) announced it will host a conference call on Thursday, November 9, 2023, at 4:30 p.m. Eastern Time, to discuss its third quarter results ending September 30, 2023. A press release detailing these results will be issued after the close of trading on the same day, with a live webcast and replay available on the company's investor relations website.

feed.title: NUBURU delivers first units to Essentium for blue laser metal 3D printing & announces GE Additive partnership
feed.summary: NUBURU has delivered initial units to Essentium as part of their multi-year partnership to develop blue laser-based 3D printing platforms for various industrial markets. Simultaneously, NUBURU announced a joint development agreement with GE Additive to explore the benefits of blue laser-based metal 3D printing, aiming to advance additive manufacturing solutions. These collaborations highlight NUBURU's expanded reach and the increasing adoption of its blue laser technology in the 3D printing sector.

feed.title: NUBURU delivers blue lasers for new metal AM system by Essentium
feed.summary: NUBURU, a leader in blue laser technology, has delivered multiple laser units to Essentium as part of a multi-year agreement to develop a blue laser-based metal additive manufacturing platform. This technology aims to target challenging materials like copper and is expected to drive significant growth in new applications and markets for Essentium. The new AM platform, integrating NUBURU's blue laser technology with Essentium's High Speed Extrusion (HSETM) 3D Printing technology, is designed for high throughput and quality in industrial markets such as automotive, aerospace, and defense.
